Package eu.shooktea.vmsm

Class Storage

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.shooktea.vmsm.Storage
  • public class Storage
extends java.lang.Object
    Storage class manages configuration file.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • registerVM

        public static void registerVM​(VirtualMachine vm)
        Register new virtual machine to be used by VMSM and saves configuration data.
        Parameters:
        vm - new virtual machine to be added to VMSM

      • removeVM

        public static void removeVM​(VirtualMachine vm)
        Removes virtual machine from VMSM storage and saves configuration data.
        Parameters:
        vm - virtual machine to be removed from VMSM

      • saveAll

        public static void saveAll()
        Tries to save configuration data. If configuration file already exists, first thing method does is creating backup. With backup already existing, method removes original configuration file and creates a new one.

        This method should be called every time some change in configuration has been introduced, to save it for future load.

      • loadAll

        public static void loadAll()
        Tries to load configuration data. If configuration file doesn't exist, method does nothing. If both configuration file and backup file exist, but configuration file is empty, data from backup file is used instead.

      • getVmList

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<VirtualMachine> getVmList()
        Returns list of registered virtual machines. That list should be used only to read data; while you can change content of that list, it won't be saved automatically - added or removed list will be updated in configuration file only after calling saveAll(), either directly or indirectly by doing some action that uses that method.

        If you want to add new virtual machine or remove existing one, use other methods of Storage class.

        Returns:
        list of registered virtual machines
        See Also:
        registerVM(VirtualMachine), removeVM(VirtualMachine)
